name: Yet Another Tom Swifty, Said MM22, Adverbially Multiple Choice Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
EXAMPLE: "I like camping," said Tom ___.  The answer is INTENTLY. 

Note: The spellings are always correct American English, although the pronunciation may not be. The hint will tell the number of words and letters.  Also the beginning and last letters IE: S/LY or S/D.

QUESTION ONE: "This sea-spray will ruin all the metal-work," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Mistrustfully.

	Sea spray is mist.  Ruined metal work rusts.  All of it, fully...Mist-Rust-fully.

questions.text: "We believe the young woman has been kidnapped", said the police chief ___.
questions.explanation:
Mistakenly.

	A kidnapped young woman = Miss taken.

questions.text: "I prefer Nathan's hot dogs," Tom said ___.
"I'll meet you at Tienanmen," Tom said ___.
questions.explanation:
Squarely.

	Tienanmen is a square in Beijing, China.

Benignly.

	B-9 would be a call in the game Bingo.

Redundantly.

	Do I really have to explain this one?

questions.text: "That's the last time I'll stick my hand in a lion's mouth," the lion-tamer said ___.
questions.explanation:
Off-handedly & off handedly&offhandedly.

	The lion bit his hand off.

questions.text: "Why is this telephone cord always tangled?" asked Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Coyly.

	Telephone cords are usually coiled.

Fearlessly.

	Eins = 1, Zwei = 2, Drei = 3, Funf = 5, in German.  There is no 4 listed, which is Veir, pronounced, fear.  So...no fear = fearlessly.

questions.text: "Sorry! I've accidentally pierced your cheek instead your lobe," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Mysteriously.

	Pierce someone's cheek by accident...Missed Ear.
